Company: Lincoln Financial Group Trust Company, Inc.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: September 3, 2019 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address.

Description: Lincoln National Life agreed to pay $12.6 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: Florida Announces a $12.6 Million Multi-State, Multi-Agency Life Claim Settlement Agreement with Lincoln, Targeted News Service, December 10, 2013 (via Nexis).

Company: Lincoln Life & Annuity Company of New York
The Lincoln National Life Insurance Co.
The Lincoln National Life Insurance Co.
Lincoln Life Assurance Company of Boston
Lincoln National Life Insurance Co. and Lincoln Financial Group
Description: Lincoln National Life Insurance Co. and Lincoln Financial Group agreed to pay a $150,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations its previous use of the automatic default option establishing a retained asset account could result in an unsuitable arrangement for a beneficiary, in violation of state regulations.

Company: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Co. et al.
Description: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company, Lincoln Life & Annuity Company of New York and First Penn-Pacific Life Insurance Company agreed to pay $2.5 million to the state as part of a settlement of allegations they had inadequate procedures to ensure policies and other funds were timely investigated and paid out to beneficiaries.

Company: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Co.

Agency: New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance

Description: Lincoln Financial Group paid $50.7 million in restitution to policyholders and a $1.5 million fine for lost insurance claims and for unfair claims settlement practices.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Company: Lincoln Life & Annuity Company of New York
Description: violations of New York Insurance regulations in deferred to immediate annuity replacement transactions
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
Rhode Island Department of Business Regulation

Description: Order to Cease and Desist No. 19-0033 rescinded and $100,000 fine levied for paying over $2 million in commissions to 2 producers who solicited, negotiated, and/or sold insurance without licenses, for conducting business through an unappointed insurance producer, and for issuing forms to a Washingto...
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Company: Lincoln National Life Insurance Company The
Description: $8,000 fine for failing to properly appoint its producers. RCW 48.17.160(2)
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Lincoln agreed to pay $264,079 in customer restitution to resolve a multistate case concerning race-based pricing practices.

Company: Lincoln Financial Securities, Inc.  and Lincoln Financial Advisors Corporation
Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority imposed fines of $450,000 against Lincoln Financial Securities, Inc. (LFS) and $150,000 against an affiliated firm, Lincoln Financial Advisors Corporation, for failure to adequately protect non-public customer information. In addition, LFS failed to require brokers working remotely to install security application software on their own personal computers used to conduct the firm's securities business.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.

Description: NASD has fined eight broker-dealers-including seven retail firms and one mutual fund distributor- more than $7.75 million for directed brokerage violations.
Info Source: NASD Charges Eight Firms with Directed Brokerage Violations, Imposes Fines Totaling More Than $7.75 Million, PR Newswire, October 10, 2005 (via Nexis).
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

Description: NASD fined Jefferson Pilot Variable Corporation, a Concord, NH broker-dealer, $325,000 for failing to have an adequate supervisory system in place to prevent market timing and excessive trading in the sub-accounts of its Ensemble series of variable universal life insurance policies (VULs).  In addition, the firm was required to pay $238,697 in restitution to the affected funds. Separately, NASD fined another affiliate, Jefferson Pilot Securities Corp. (JPSC), also of Concord, $125,000 for failing to retain all e-mail communications of its registered persons.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

Description: NASD censured and fined 29 securities firms over $9.2 million for more than 8,000 late disclosures of reportable information about their brokers, including customer complaints, regulatory actions, and criminal charges and convictions.
Info Source: NASD Fines 29 Firms over $9.2 Million for Late Reporting, PR Newswire, November 30, 2004 (via Nexis).
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
